alert.note: Alert for Yavapai (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 14 at 1:59PM MST until August 14 at 5:00PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: The National Weather Service in Flagstaff has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Yavapai County in west central Arizona... * Until 500 PM MST. * At 159 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 2.25 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Crown King, Wagoner, Walnut Grove, Wilhoit, Cordes, Bumble Bee, Peeples Valley, Spring Valley, Yarnell, Cordes Junction, Kirkland, Cordes Lakes, Skull Valley, Congress, Turney Gulch Group Campground, Hazlett Hollow Campground and Glen Ilah. This includes the following highways... State Route 69 between mile markers 263 and 268. Interstate 17 between mile markers 244 and 265. State Route 71 near mile marker 109. State Route 89 between mile markers 262 and 295. This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Many creeks and washes across the warned area.. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Move to higher ground now. Act quickly to protect your life.
